page.title: 01SWINDERBY IN LINCOLNSHIRE.
page.content: {SWINDERBY} is a small Lincolnshire village, the population is 629. It is midway between Lincoln and Newark and is connected by regular {buses} and {trains.}There is a typical old village shop,a Mace Shop and a mobile library. The village has a Parish Church first recorded between 925 and 940 AD. and a{Methodist Church.}These are the meeting places of the villagers along with the Village Hall and the {Plough {Public House.} Swinderby is surrounded by trees and {farmland} where vegetables and cereal crops are grown. Livestock is kept by some farmers. The{children}of 5 to 11 years attend the Village School and the 11's to 18's go to North Hykeham by special bus.There is a{play area}with climbing frames and swings and a playing field for the children.
